intro: Diplochita parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered diplochita, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its leaves are opposite and often have a slightly hairy texture. Diplochita parviflora is primarily found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
